name: biomni-query-clinicaltrials
title: Biomni: Query Clinicaltrials
description: Search ClinicalTrials.gov for information about clinical research studies on a wide range of diseases and conditions.
content:
Overview

Queries ClinicalTrials.gov, the world's largest clinical trials registry containing over 400,000 studies from 220 countries. Access comprehensive information about ongoing and completed clinical trials including study design, eligibility criteria, outcomes, and results.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about clinical trials
  • endpoint (string, optional): Direct API endpoint URL or path
  • term (string, optional): Search term for trials (disease, drug, or condition)
  • status (string, optional): Trial status filter (e.g., "RECRUITING", "COMPLETED")
  • condition (string, optional): Disease or condition being studied
  • intervention (string, optional): Drug, device, or procedure being tested
  • location (string, optional): Geographic location of trials
  • phase (string, optional): Clinical trial phase (e.g., "PHASE1", "PHASE2", "PHASE3")
  • page_size (integer, optional): Number of results per page (default: 10)
  • max_pages (integer, optional): Maximum pages to retrieve (default: 1)
  • page_token (string, optional): Token for pagination
  • verbose (boolean, optional): Enable detailed logging (default: true)

Input Format

Create a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "term": "breast cancer",
  "status": "RECRUITING",
  "phase": "PHASE3",
  "location": "United States",
  "page_size": 20
}

Biological Use Case

Essential for clinicians and researchers to identify relevant clinical trials for patients, track therapeutic development, understand trial landscape for specific diseases, identify potential collaborations, and inform evidence-based medical decisions. Patients use it to find enrollment opportunities for novel treatments.

Output

Returns a JSON file (clinicaltrials_results.json) containing trial details including NCT identifiers, study titles, sponsors, enrollment criteria, intervention details, outcome measures, locations, contact information, and status updates for matching clinical studies.

Category

database
